name: Calamus Vector Graphic
summary: Learn about .CVG files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Students, designers, and publishing professionals who use Calamus to work with desktop publishing projects are most likely to encounter CVG files. The files store graphics as scalable shapes and paths rather than pixels, which allows users to resize images without losing quality. Users can edit the vector paths, adjust colors, and apply effects directly within the program.

description: A CVG file is a vector image created by invers Software Calamus, a discontinued desktop publishing program commonly used in Europe. It contains individual graphic elements or illustrations for designing larger documents, such as brochures, flyers, or reports. CVG files may also include effects, layers, and other design elements used in professional layouts.

instructions: You can open CVG files with Lemkesoft GraphicConverter in macOS. Invers Software Calamus can also open CVG files, but it is discontinued.
